title: Firefox Bookmarks - Too few tags permitted
content:
Hi, I trust you all had a (well deserved) merry Christmas.

I have a question regarding bookmarks in Firefox. This is something that has been bugging me for some years (yes, it has taken me that long to get around to asking about this). Over the last decade I have amounted a large assortment of bookmarks, which I have carefully structured and also add suitable tags to (as I know what I am likely to search for in future). This works very well for me and it's surprising how my past self has been so accurate at predicting what I may find useful to my present/future self, when it comes to searching for something in my bookmarks.

Herein lies my problem though. I often need to put in a number of tags to make a given web resource findable in the future. For example, I was just reading up about the Google compute module, and have been trying to enter the following tags: Google Edge TPU (Neural compute) sbc network artificial intelligence machine vision intel stick Quantization

This number of keywords is too long, yet I don't want to really remove any of these words/acronyms. Why are the bookmarks so heavily restricted with regards to tags? I see that when I look at the bookmarks, there is also a **keywords** option too, but those words are not searchable, so I don't see much value in placing anything in there.

I am not 100% sure, but I could swear too, that bookmarks used to have a description section too, where I could make notes regarding a weblink (EG: "this website has particularly good recipes for pasta, but ignore their vegatarian options as they don't review very favorably"). I may be thinking of another web browser from a long time ago. Having a description field for each bookmark (which is not restricted to a ridiculously short length like the **Tags** field) would be an excellent idea.

so, to summarize: 1. How do I work around having such a short **Tag** field (and when is Mozilla going to fix this?) 2. Can we please have a Description field for each bookmark. Please!

These are just about my only criticisms of what is otherwise my absolute favorite of browsers. Thanks for the great work and effort by all, and have a prosperous and healthy 2021.
creator: gawardnz

title: Firefox freezes when opening external links
content:
Firefox, upon opening with a link passed as a parameter (clicking a link in some other application which opens up the default browser to that URL), freezes completely and prevents me from manually opening a new instance, saying that another Firefox instance is already running. Opening a system monitor shows a running Firefox process, pointing to the previously clicked URL, but does not respond at all. CPU and RAM usage are both 0 for this process, so it's likely not even doing anything. Not even a SIGTERM will terminate the process, I have to throw at least two SIGKILLs at the process for it to die. Why is this a thing? I've been using this browser on this exact same system for almost a year now, this was never a problem before.

OS: Arch Linux Kernel: Linux, 5.9.14-arch1-1 Firefox Version: 84.0.1

title: FF STILL closing the Print to pdf window for directory selection and file naming prior to Save.
content:
Yes, i recall the last time i was asking for help with this issue i was told to post it as a bug somewhere. I went to "Feedback" thinking that was logical, but apparently Mozilla is reworking Feedback so that does not exist, and as i am not a software developer, i suspect a technical bug report is over my head anyway.

I don't want to go to Edge, but it would seem Mozilla wants me to. This issue has persisted ever since release 79. I would think that the programmer(s) could "simply" look at what changed from 78 to 79 and revert, but apparently not.

I, once again, have to uninstall the latest release (i installed it, allowing an "upgrade", thinking that by now someone there would have fixed that which at least to me is a critical routine), and reinstall Version 78.0, since that one isn't f'd up. Maybe it is all the enhanced "security" that is now interfering with normal processes, i don't know. That also means I have to get used to the new browser and hopefully finding a reliable password manager to which i can import pages of entries from Kee.

Yes, i know i will get a share of hate mail for criticizing FF at this point. Just consider how infuriating it is after using it since beta 0.3 and having made donations, having what i see as a critical issue ignored, and worse, forcing me to soon change to Edge if no one fixes it. As much as i hate using the Microsoft browser, at least it does not force the Microsoft "Save" dialog box to collapse when trying to print to a pdf, and i am rather disgusted that no one from FF has reached out to try to fix this issue.

And yes, i did try it in safe mode (run firefox.exe /safe) and "Restart with Addons disabled" from the menu|Help, neither of which were successful.

If any of you know how to get this note to someone competent at FF, please do so and let me know to hold off on switching; i dread having to do that, but printing to pdf is mission critical in the conduct of my business.

title: Sustainability-project at the University of Applied Sciences Salzburg
content:
Dear Mozilla Firefox support team,

we are Marius Oeller and Chris Trausnitz and are students at the University of Applied Sciences Salzburg in Austria. We would need your help for a project we want to do in the context of sustainability at our university.

We want to install the search engine "Ecosia" as the standard search engine on our university server system.

Ecosia drives and supports the planting of forests by means of the search queries. By using Ecosia at an entire university, the number of search queries would of course increase further and thus strongly support the sustainable project of Ecosia.

To implement our idea, we contacted the IT department of our university, but they told us that they would have to change the default settings of Mozilla Firefox or change them manually with every browser update.

However, we didn't want to give in that easily and so we are now contacting you directly to ask if our project could be realized somehow.

We would be glad to hear from you and wish you a good start into the year 2021!!!

With kind regards,

Marius Oeller and Chris Trausnitz

title: Youtube in 4K 30 FPS stuttering on Firefox. No stuttering on 4K 60 FPS.
content:
Win10 Bootcamp on new MacBook Pro with Radeon Pro 5600M. Device is powerful enough to run latest AAA games in high quality on 4K at 60 FPS.

New Edge plays videos like this in 4K at 30 FPS really well, but Firefox has very minor stuttering that is extremely annoying, as if it drops 1 frame out of 10, but "stats for nerds" don't show it. The videos just aren't as *smooth* as in Edge. It also has a big 1-2 second lag immediately after I change quality to 4K or unpause after switching tabs back, this doesn't exist on Edge.

Curiously, it plays 4K 60 FPS like this with much *less* lagging. I still notice a very minor stuttering compared to Edge, but not bad enough to be annoying, because it goes from 60 FPS to ~30 FPS at those times apparently.

Codec is VP9 in Edge and FF.

Tried: 

- safe mode - same issue - clean portable 86.0 Alpha 1 - same issue - about:support is here, I don't see anything criminal - performance profile using graphics preset is here: https://share.firefox.dev/3nMpss

I'm not sure where to dig here, since it's happening consistently even on latest nightly build and the symptoms are this weird.
creator: atata

title: Unable to save .mkv downloads without being asked, with 'open' as default, no checkbox
content:
On multiple machines (Windows 7-10), if I click on an MP4 or other media file, I have the option of checking the box to save the file without asking in the future. With .mkv files, the checkbox isn't there, so every time I have to go through the process of changing the default (play) action to save the file. I've checked preferences and there's no way to add mkv files to the default actions. I deleted the handlers... file to reset and start over, but same behavior...it wants to play the file, with no option to quit asking and just save it.

On these same machines, I can do the same download process with any other browser such as Opera, and it just saves the file as I've instructed it to do in preferences. So why the different (and long-term consistent) and annoying behavior with firefox? MP4, AVI, fine, but MKV?? No option, and it's not as if it's a new file type or new behavior.

I suppose one could say "what's the big deal, just change it when it asks?", but it seems like nonsensical and pointless behavior, which has continued for a long time, with other browsers able to deal with it properly. At the very least, how about a way to add file extensions manually to the list of actions in the options?

Please don't blame the web server for "not sending the proper information", as I've seen in some non-solution posts; the .mkv extension should tell enough, and it's over many servers. I looked in the registry to see if perchance I could patch it in there, but couldn't find entries, so I assume it's all in the handlers file.
creator: roberthaus

title: How to disable that mouse thumb buttons trigger "previous page" and "next page" in Firefox?
content:
I really want to disable that Firefox uses the mouse thumb buttons 4 and 5 as "previous page" and "next page" commands.

Example: Sometimes I study/play for hours a chess problem on https://tactics.chessbase.com/de/Solve but as soon the page gets reloaded it will be a new chess problem - no way to go back!

Somebody wrote a solution to disable the backspace key (on keyboard) triggering the "previous page" command, assuming the mouse thumb button 4 would be used by Firefox as backspace key. Unfortunately this assumption proofed to be wrong. The solution only disabled the backspace key to trigger the "previous page" command, but the mouse thumb buttons STILL DO TRIGGER the "previous page" and "next page" commands.

Where can I disable the mouse thumb buttons in Firefox - without disable the thumb buttons entirely in the Logitec software?
creator: schaerer-marc

title: Firefox Browser will not receive history from iOS
content: Firefox Browser will not receive history from iOS, how to fix? Everything else seems to work except history syncing. However, I still can sync history TO my phone, but not from it.
creator: danielsstamper

title: O firefox impediu que esta página fosse recarregada automaticamente.
content: Oi gente, estou recebendo esta mensagem o tempo todo. Já vi em alguns fóruns sobre ir em opções-avançado e desmarcar um box. Porém na versão do firefox que estou usando, depois de opções não existe o "avançado". Como eu faço para resolver este problema nas versões mais novas do firefox?
creator: rafaelelt
